description:
I have now seen this several times in devstack-gate

Occasionally instances will go into error state, and when checking the logs, I see the error is in nova-scheduler where the heartbeat is too old, which causes the scheduler to not schedule on that node.


http://logs.openstack.org/97/45497/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/084442d/logs/screen-n-sch.txt.gz#_2013-09-07_00_06_14_880


From logfile:

 DB_Driver.is_up last_heartbeat = 2013-09-07 00:04:47.516557 elapsed = 87.363841 is_up /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py:71

  (devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-229926, devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-229926) ram:5170 disk:210944 io_ops:5 instances:18 is disabled or has not been heard from in a while host_passes /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/scheduler/filters/compute_filter.py:44
 
  Filter ComputeFilter returned 0 host(s) get_filtered_objects /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/filters.py:85
[instance: 415fb048-1d47-4fb8-8974-323529d8b1b5] Setting instance to ERROR state.
20
title: compute node heartbeat out of sync causing scheduler to fail in devstack:  VMs fail to spawn

comments.content:
I have now seen this several times in devstack-gate

Occasionally instances will go into error state, and when checking the logs, I see the error is in nova-scheduler where the heartbeat is too old, which causes the scheduler to not schedule on that node.


http://logs.openstack.org/97/45497/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/084442d/logs/screen-n-sch.txt.gz#_2013-09-07_00_06_14_880


From logfile:

 DB_Driver.is_up last_heartbeat = 2013-09-07 00:04:47.516557 elapsed = 87.363841 is_up /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py:71

  (devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-229926, devstack-precise-hpcloud-az1-229926) ram:5170 disk:210944 io_ops:5 instances:18 is disabled or has not been heard from in a while host_passes /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/scheduler/filters/compute_filter.py:44
 
  Filter ComputeFilter returned 0 host(s) get_filtered_objects /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/filters.py:85
[instance: 415fb048-1d47-4fb8-8974-323529d8b1b5] Setting instance to ERROR state.
20
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: more examples of this bug can be found by searching logstash.openstack.org for '@tags:"logs/screen-n-sch.txt" AND @message:"Setting instance to ERROR state"'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: better search query: @tags:"logs/screen-n-sch.txt" AND @message:(tempest* AND  "Setting instance to ERROR state")
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: I thought this was not a bug, just lag causing timeouts, hence my not rechecking against it. Thanks for clarifying that it is actually an out of sync problem.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~clint-fewbar

comments.content: Since nova-compute has no DB access it goes to the conductor as a call, and it appears that even in a failing case (http://logs.openstack.org/86/45486/3/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/b0bf0f2/) that the conductor is getting the update_service call (heartbeat) every 10 seconds. So somehow that information is not getting to the scheduler.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
In the example of: http://logs.openstack.org/86/45486/3/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/b0bf0f2/

It looks like nova-conductor stops receiving the 'conductor.service_update' command from nova-compute  at some point, after which point nova-compute's heartbeat doesn't write to the DB.

http://logs.openstack.org/86/45486/3/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/b0bf0f2/logs/screen-n-cond.txt.gz#_2013-09-09_18_53_58_112
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/45974
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/45975
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Around the same time as nova-compute stops logging we also see  the following in syslog:

Sep 11 19:09:19 devstack-precise-hpcloud-az2-252483 kernel: [ 1188.107081] type=1400 audit(1378926559.813:310): apparmor="STATUS" operation="profile_remove" name="libvirt-2c0614b6-9a7d-4a7f-af91-3ef08df56bc9" pid=10126 comm="apparmor_parser"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
We talked about it in the ceilometer team meeting today and agreed that if the plugin is causing issues with the gate, it should be left out of the nova configuration for now.

Joe scheduled a summit session to work out how to do the notification better: http://summit.openstack.org/cfp/details/73
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~doug-hellmann

comments.content:
celio makes nova-compute timeout in what appears to be two different ways.  One is found here:

http://logs.openstack.org/58/46358/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/4f94066/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2013-09-13_19_35_17_001

where ceilo times out for a minute causing the heartbeat to stop for just over a minute
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: If this is related to Celiometer, this should be documented in the release.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: This should be closed, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46336/.  Waiting a few days to make sure the fix works though.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: Bug hasn't been seen all day, looks like the fix worked
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: Some of the rechecks is really related to this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1229590
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content:
I will be out of the office starting  2013/10/01 and will not return until
2013/10/07.

I will check mails at night and try to respond you ASAP
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~xingzhou

comments.content: I'm a little confused with this. Does this mean the ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier driver is broken and shouldn't be used with Havana?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sorrison

comments.content: Sam, yes, that is exactly what it means.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: marking this as won't fix on ceilometer end. we removed the nova_notifier as the plugin mechanism didn't play well with nova
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chungg
